official-title.#text:
To provide for the establishment of a Commission on the
		  Advancement of Social Enterprise.

committee-name.#text:
Committee
			 on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Social Enterprise Ecosystem and
			 Economic Development Commission Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Commission on the
			 advancement of social enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (referred to in this section as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Commission on the Advancement of
			 Social Enterprise
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

term.#tail:
).
			 The purpose of the commission is to examine and make recommendations with
			 respect to ways the Federal Government can support and utilize the
			 transformative power of social enterprises.

text.#text:
There
			 is established a commission to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
does not apply
			 to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Advisory Committee Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: established under this subsection.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be composed of the following or their
			 designees:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator
			 of the Small Business Administration

Administrator
			 of the Economic Development Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: n.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of
			 the Office of Social Innovation and Civic Participatio
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Social Innovation and Civic Participatio

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chief
			 Executive Officer of the Corporation for National and Community Service

Assistant to
			 the President for Domestic Policy
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Domestic Policy Council

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of
			 the Office of Management and Budget

Director of
			 the National Economic Council
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Economic Council

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of Health and Human
			 Services

Secretary of Housing and Urban
			 Development

Chair of the Council of Economic
			 Advisors

Administrator of the General Services
			 Administration

text.#text:
The Director of the Office of Social
			 Innovation and Civic Participation shall serve as the Chairperson of the
			 Commission.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall meet at the call of the
			 Chairperson.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

text.#text:
The initial meeting shall take place not later than 30
			 days after the date of enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall constitute a quorum, but a
			 lesser number of members may hold hearings.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

text.#text:
A
			 majority of the members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may establish, by majority vote, any rules for the conduct of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
business, in accordance with this Act and other applicable
			 law.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish criteria for identifying social
			 enterprises for purposes of Federal programs. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
will draw upon
			 existing leading research and scholarship in this area as well as the input of
			 practitioners and policy experts within the social enterprise field.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the initial meeting of the

How
			 social enterprise can accelerate progress on social issues.

How
			 social enterprises work in a cross-sector manner.

How social
			 enterprise can advance social and economic development goals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall identify opportunities for the
			 Federal Government to more effectively engage social enterprises in creating
			 jobs and strengthening local economies while achieving optimal outcomes in
			 addressing policy challenges at the national, state, and local level. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall receive and consider reports and testimony from individuals,
			 government departments, State and local elected officials, community-based
			 organizations, nonprofit organizations, faith-based organizations, foundations,
			 and other public and private organizations statewide and of national
			 significance on the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

text.#text:
The
			 role of social enterprises in the United States economy.

The
			 role of social enterprises in addressing economic, social, and environmental
			 policy challenges across all levels of government.

The role of
			 social enterprises as community support and development entities.

A
			 statistical and qualitative examination of social enterprise within the United
			 States and its contribution to the social and economic development of the
			 United States.

Means through
			 which the Federal Government can assist in enhancing the capacity of social
			 enterprises.

Corporate legal
			 structures that foster or impede the development of social enterprises.

How to reform
			 the Internal Revenue Code to reduce obstacles that social enterprises face when
			 addressing social issues and creating economic value through innovative
			 methods.

How to reform
			 Federal securities laws to encourage impact investing.

How
			 the Federal Government can leverage existing Community Development Financial
			 Institutions programs.

How
			 various sectors (including but not limited to philanthropic, for-profit, and
			 non-profit sectors) and levels of government currently interact with social
			 enterprises.

Review of the
			 current process through which social enterprises—both for-profit and nonprofit
			 organizations—can obtain Federal loans, grants, and contracts and offer
			 recommendations for improving these processes in light of the special needs and
			 contributions of social enterprises.

Review of the
			 current process, policies, and procedures through which social enterprises—both
			 for-profit and nonprofit organizations—can access Federal contracting
			 opportunities and offer recommendations for improving the access of social
			 enterprises to Federal procurement opportunities.

How the Federal
			 Government can play a role in developing a purchasing directory of social
			 enterprises within the United States that can be supported by citizens,
			 businesses, and government.

Opportunities for the Federal Government to
			 develop and expand research and the collection and analysis of longitudinal
			 data on social enterprises.

Opportunities for the development of an
			 entity or initiative to support intermediaries that will promote and invest in
			 social enterprise.

Identification
			 of the appropriate entity within the Federal Government that shall be charged
			 with the responsibility of preparing an annual report to Congress on the impact
			 of social enterprises in the United States and the extent to which the Federal
			 Government interacts with, supports, and invests in social enterprises. And,
			 where appropriate, this entity shall monitor and update the areas of study
			 listed in this subparagraph.

under this paragraph shall include
			 the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

The areas studied and potential

Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

Commission on the Advancement of Social Enterprise

without reimbursement, and such detail shall be without interruption or loss of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
